greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle A127647 * A097806, read by rows.
link: G. C. Greubel, Rows n = 1..100 of triangle, flattened
formula: A127646 * A097806 as infinite lower triangular matrices.
example: First few rows of the triangle are:
mathematica: Table[If[k==n || k==n-1, Fibonacci[n], 0]], {n, 15}, {k, n}]//Flatten (* _G. C. Greubel_, Jul 11 2019 *)
program: (PARI) T(n,k) = if(k==n || k==n-1, fibonacci(n), 0); \\ _G. C. Greubel_, Jul 11 2019
(MAGMA) [k eq n select Fibonacci(n) else k eq n-1 select Fibonacci(n) else 0: k in [1..n], n in [1..15]]; // _G. C. Greubel_, Jul 11 2019
[[T(n, k) for k in (1..n)] for n in (1..15)] # _G. C. Greubel_, Jul 11 2019
results.author: _Gary W. Adamson_, Mar 10 2007
